circumstances: Sharon Wilson, a young girl in foster care, was reported missing from Nicolton Avenue. It was believed she might have possibly joined a commune as she was last seen near her friend's house on Park Avenue. Authorities searched nearby locations, including a shed and the juvenile center at 1 Arnothill, Falkirk. Her foster father, Joshua Roberts, along with Francesca Jones, met with police at the juvenile center. She was eventually found safe at 88 High Station Road, Falkirk.
q_3_explanation: Sharon is only 6 years old, making her vulnerable due to her age.
q_17_explanation: Going missing at such a young age is unusual behavior for her.

circumstances: Sharon Wilson was last seen around her home on Nicolton Avenue, displaying personality changes noticed by her foster father, Joshua Roberts, prior to her disappearance. Potentially upset by an incident at a school-related location, she later visited a shed located near 1-42 West Lodge Gardens, Alloa, FK10 2HX. Josephine, a close friend and colleague of Joshua, noted Sharon's interest in sea kayaking, which led to early speculations of a possible sea kayaking accident. Despite initial low-risk assessment, concern grew as the hours passed with no sign of Sharon.
